intro: Palicourea adenophora, commonly known as the hairy palicourea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and typically have five petals. While not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles.
